translate-1.title: The advantages of an apartment near the sea
translate-1.contenu:
When you buy a property, it's not only the design that counts. The geographical location is just as important as it contributes to the well-being you will feel after your move. Seaside apartments are in ever-increasing demand. Find out why without delay.

To enjoy a splendid view

Imagine waking up every morning to a majestic sea and seeing that same sea seemingly merge with the starry sky every evening. Some seaside communities also overlook the mountains or open onto forest landscapes. It is the beauty of nature that stretches before your eyes, to contemplate at will! Depending on the orientation of the openings (windows, bay windows...) you could also admire a large part of the city at once. The apartments located on the highest floors are particularly advantageous. Indeed, the view becomes more interesting as you move away from the ground. This is due to the absence (or at least the considerable reduction) of obstacles that obstruct the view.

To invest in a prestigious apartment

The seaside is appreciated by the elite. Actors, models, stars of the song... they are numerous to settle on the coast. This is because the setting is conducive to the construction and development of luxury apartments. With the democratization of financing solutions, these prestigious properties are now accessible to almost everyone. Indeed, luxury is more expensive. Nevertheless, you invest in stone and a seaside apartment is undeniably a refuge value. This ideally located apartment can be rented out. The income thus generated will be used to improve your living conditions or will be saved to ensure a comfortable old age. The real estate heritage that a seaside apartment represents can also be passed on to your descendants. Add to this the fact that a sale remains interesting if you need a larger apartment or, conversely, a smaller one.

To see the sun rise and set over the sea

There are so many people who pay a lot of money for a stay by the sea, even if it's just for a weekend. They don't just come for the water recreation and good weather. Indeed, the sight of the sun rising or setting over the horizon is also one of the main attractions of coastal destinations. You don't see the time passing when you are facing this magnificence. It's so relaxing that stress flies away without difficulty. Moreover, this quietude is combined with the beauty of the phenomenon. The landscape changes colors, the light gives way to darkness or vice versa. You can admire this romantic scenery without having to leave your apartment. Sit in front of the window or on the balcony and enjoy it with a glass (or a cup) in your hand. If you live alone, this exceptional panorama will allow you to decompress before/after a hard day. As a couple, you'll have the opportunity to share idyllic moments at home, with a beautiful sky in the background. If you have children, you can share magical moments with your family.

To enjoy the invigorating sea air

Sea air is appreciated for its purity. It contains more iodine and negative ions than the air that circulates in cities far from the sea. Sea air contains very few germs, which makes it better for your health. Sea air is also a valuable ally for the skin. That's because it's full of salt, which is enriched with trace elements and minerals that promote cell regeneration. It is a common misconception that sea salt causes skin dryness. In reality, it is prolonged exposure to the sun that causes this problem. So make sure to protect yourself from UV rays and you'll find that your skin is naturally cleansed every time it is exposed to the sea air. Beyond the health and beauty benefits, the sea air is a natural invigorator. Every morning, open your window wide and treat yourself to a breath of fresh sea air. You'll be energized for the day. The same goes for when you come home exhausted. Take a deep breath and let the magic happen.

If you live in Nice, to have the chance to have a sea view on the Promenade des Anglais

Nice is one of the most famous and popular seaside cities. Many apartments are available in the Bay of Angels. They offer you a breathtaking view of the famous avenue that is the Promenade des Anglais. This area which benefits from an exceptional situation gathers a great number of palaces of which the Negresco. It is also on this avenue that you will find the prestigious Masséna museum. The Prom' also hosts various cultural events. Every year, in February, the Nice Carnival is held there. It is the third largest carnival in the world, the first two places being attributed to Rio and Venice. You can mingle with the crowds or watch the festivities from your luxury apartment in Nice, such as those listed on the official Haussmann website. In addition to the view, you can walk, run or cycle along the Promenade des Anglais to keep fit and healthy. Add to this the sea air that we have just mentioned and you will see how pleasant it is to live near the Mediterranean. Buying an apartment by the sea is like spending the whole year on vacation! You will enjoy a splendid view, a high quality environment, fresh air, and the list goes on. There is no shortage of exceptional properties, but each one has its own distinctive features. It is precisely this difference that will help you find the seaside apartment that meets your search criteria.

translate-2.title: Travel agency: what are its strengths?
translate-2.h1: The 4 advantages of the travel agency
translate-2.contenu:
Whether you like to plan your next vacation in advance or prefer last-minute deals, it is important to think about every aspect of your trip for a successful one. Entrusting the organization to a professional frees you from many constraints and ensures you find an offer that really suits you. Zoom on the advantages of going through a tour operator.

Preferential rates

The total cost of the trip is one of the main concerns of holidaymakers. Often, the planned budget is quickly exhausted by adding up the cost of airfare,accommodation and activities. Travel agencies usually collaborate with privileged providers in different sectors of activity. They often receive special rates from hoteliers and restaurateurs for the destinations they cover as a honeymoon destination. This includes luxury hotels, bed and breakfasts and vacation rentals, and if necessary, a tour operator can negotiate the price of the stay with the establishment you are interested in. The agencies can also get you preferential rates on transportation to the destination, depending on your vacation dates. It will therefore be easy for you to put together a trip that suits your means and your desires. In addition, agency offers usually include travel insurance. Depending on the insurance formula chosen, the tour operator will take care of the cancellation or interruption of your stay in case of early return. You will benefit from a financial guarantee to cover cancellation costs and possibly repatriation, if you have an accident or fall ill.

A considerable saving of time

When you organize your trip yourself, it is imperative to compare transportation and accommodation offers, among others. Checking the advantages of a direct or connecting trip and finding out about the services of hoteliers is time-consuming. By using a professional, you can access turnkey packages that include round-trip flights, hotel transfers and meals. All you have to do is tell a travel agent your preferences and budget. In addition to travel and accommodations, the travel agent may recommend popular activities in the destination, in which case the tour operator will include excursions and tours in the package, specifying the cost of the activities if they are not free. Depending on the destination, they may book a pass that allows you to access several tourist sites or local public transportation. If you prefer to remain autonomous, the travel agent can also find a rental car for you to pick up upon arrival. The travel agent will present the possible tours in detail to help you choose the one that meets your expectations. You will be able to book a stay oriented towards culture, nature, relaxation or including different points of interest to satisfy all the people participating in the trip. Many tour operators also offer to take care of the administrative formalities if you are planning a vacation abroad. They will take care of the visa application for countries where it is necessary, inform you of mandatory vaccinations and organize medical appointments for you.

Advisors at your service

Contacting a travel specialist avoids many disappointments. Most agencies present their recommended destinations on their website. Don't hesitate to ask about the offers before making an appointment with a travel agent. This will allow you to specify your desires and preferences to your tour operator. An agency provides personalized support throughout the trip. You will benefit from their expertise regarding customs, weather and amenities in the destination. You will have a serious and competent interlocutor to advise you on the best periods to organize your next trip, in terms of budget, tourist frequentation or activities. Your consultant will be available throughout your trip to help you manage any unforeseen events. He or she will explain what to do if you miss your connection, if you lose your luggage or if your hotel is not suitable.

A trip that's just like you

A tour operator will study every aspect of your stay with you in order to offer you customized trips. He will take into account all your requirements and the length of your vacation, so that you can complete the tour of your dreams, whether you are going for a few days or several weeks. The travel agent will help you find a guide if you are visiting a destination for the first time. A travel agent can recommend possible activities around your hotel if you are planning a short stay. He or she can recommend day trips to nearby towns and villages if you have more time. They will advise you on museums, galleries and monuments to see during a city break. He will suggest itineraries adapted to your physical condition, if you are looking for a change of scenery and nature outings. He can also recommend unusual attractions to see if you like to travel off the beaten track.To do this, he will adapt his offer to the number and age of the participants. They can also offer you themed vacation packages to help you organize a honeymoon, a getaway for a family or a vacation with friends. Agencies usually offer a la carte travel packages that you can easily customize by adding the options that interest you. In short, you get personalized advice and guarantees on your stay by planning your trip with the help of a travel agent. You'll be sure to experience a vacation that perfectly matches your desire toescape.

translate-3.title: Honeymoon Destination Idea: Mauritius
translate-3.contenu:
Mauritius is the perfect destination for a honeymoon. Its white sandy beaches, turquoise lagoons, and many upscale all-inclusive vacations make it the ideal destination for a newlywed couple.

Hotels for a relaxing wedding

Once you've packed your bags, opt for one of the boutique hotels this honeymoon destination offers for unforgettable memories. You can stay at an upscale hotel with a gourmet restaurant, spa, and golf course. You may prefer a comfortable bungalow with a private pool, which is more intimate and romantic, or a house on stilts with a breathtaking view of the lagoon. [caption id="attachment_234" align="aligncenter" width="3264"] Choose between a resort or a private home.[/caption] Either way, a stay in Mauritius offers a timeless escape, and allows couples to reinvent themselves, or forge memories to last a lifetime. A resort on the island means rest and magic.

Beaches for a lazy wedding

Mauritius is famous for its beautiful beaches. In the shade of palm trees, coconut palms, filaos, within a lush vegetation and in a sovereign calm, you will enjoy moments of well-deserved rest. You want to know what paradise looks like? Opt for the most beautiful beaches of Mauritius. In the north, enjoy the beach of Trou aux Biches, a perfect setting for lovers. Many gourmet restaurants line the paths leading to the beach. The ribbon of fine sand continues to the northwest to Mont Choisy Beach. Serenity lovers, you have found your domain! The landscape here resembles a luxurious outdoor swimming pool, in the calm and shade of a superb vegetation. The beach of Mont Choisy is also known to be the theater of very pleasant festive barbecues, and dances. Still to the north, Cap Malheureux is a small town, with fishermen and beautiful colonial houses, which offers a beautiful and quiet beach [caption id="attachment_232" align="aligncenter" width="3264"] Endless beaches[/caption] To the south, Blue Bay beach, at Pointe d'Esny, is a haven of peace. What a pleasure to sunbathe in peace, to enjoy a time that stops, without stress, without worries. However, boredom is not an option, because the nearby underwater world is exceptionally rich in tropical fish and beautiful coral. You can simply swim, with mask and snorkel. You may prefer the pristine white sand of La Cambuse beach, or Bel Ombre beach, with its turquoise blue lagoon. In the east of Mauritius, the beaches of Belle Mare, Poste Lafayette, and of course Ile aux cerfs, are also famous. In the west, you can discover the serenity of the beach of Flic en Flac, the bay of Tamarin with its view on the estuary of the Rempart mountain and its numerous surfers, or the small quiet beach of Pomponnette. There is only the embarrassment of the choice. Mauritius is a tropical island with its feet in the water, where you can recharge your batteries with delight, bask in the sun and, at the end of the day, admire unforgettable sunsets.

Historical sites for a cultural wedding

There is so much to see in Mauritius! Visit for example during your stay the Eureka House, south of Port Louis. It is a beautiful colonial house that belonged to the family of the writer Le Clezio, with a nice craft store on the spot, and the possibility to taste an absolutely divine Creole meal. In Port-Louis, you can visit very different sites, all witnesses of a multicultural society, with for example the Chinese pagoda of the centenary in Caudan, the Jummah mosque, or the Kaylasson temple. Not far from there, still in the north of the island, visit the colonial manor of Château de Labourdonnais. [caption id="attachment_235" align="aligncenter" width="3264"] Be open to the mix of cultures[/caption] Don't miss the most picturesque markets of the island. You will find local handicrafts, quality fabrics, fruits, vegetables, spices, and above all, authentic contact with a warm population. For example, visit the Goodlands market, not far from Grand Bay in the north of the island. The stalls open between 9:30 and 10 am. Take the opportunity to visit the Hindu temple, a stone's throw from the market, as well as the Saint-Antoine Mansion and its park. A little further, you will find in the market of Curepipe models of boats, replicas of old models. Finally, if you pass by Floreal, located like Curepipe in the Wilhems Plains district in the center of the island, you will also find nice handicraft souvenirs. Don't forget to try the local food, from street vendors, such as the delicious Indian roast "paratha", or chili cake.

Hiking for a fresh air wedding

Brides and grooms will enjoy exploring the trails of Mauritius, characterized by lush vegetation, nearby beaches, and many spectacular waterfalls. The land here is volcanic, which guarantees breathtaking landscapes, rich in various colors, such as those of the Land of 7 Colors, near the village of Chamarel, in the southwest of the island. You can also choose an excursion, in the southwest of the island, to the summit of Morne Brabant, 555 meters high. This is a rather difficult trek, as the slope is rather steep. Nature is king throughout the island and calls for a walk. Centuries-old botanical gardens are worth a visit. In the north of the island, don't miss the Sir Seewoosagur Ramgoolam Garden, also called the Pamplemousses Garden, with its giant water lilies of almost two meters in diameter, its ebony or mahogany trees, and so many other magnificent plant species. [caption id="attachment_236" align="aligncenter" width="3264"] Palms for a peaceful atmosphere[/caption] Excursions can also be maritime. If you have your sea legs, opt for a catamaran, or a glass-bottom boat, which will take you to the beautiful Ile aux Cerfs, on the east coast of the island. Most departures to Ile aux Cerfs take place from the village of Trou d'Eau Douce. Once you arrive at your destination, you will enjoy an exceptional beach in an idyllic setting, various water sports, and, no doubt, a delicious barbecue. Mauritius is an ideal travel destination. This terribly welcoming land reconciles us with nature and time, an omnipresent nature, strong, preserved, which invites to dream and escape, a suspended time that prepares the memories of a lifetime. A honeymoon in these lands is bound to be unforgettable.

translate-4.title: The best suitcases for travel
translate-4.h1: Which luggage items to choose for travel?
translate-4.contenu:
Before leaving on a trip, the first thing to do is to prepare your travel bag. Our main concern is to define the type of suitcase adapted as well as the things to take along. The choice of the suitcase is essential for more practicality and security for our things. Here is how to choose your suitcase for a trip.

A cabin size suitcase

The cabin luggage is the most practical to accompany you in your travels during your trip. To help you choose the right model, you must consider several criteria starting with the sturdiness, the lightness, the number of wheels, the closing system, the capacity and the brand. All of these criteria will vary depending on the type of trip you are taking. You should also know that if you don't want to part with your suitcase even on the plane or train, you should choose the ultra light cabin suitcase. The standard imposed by IATA on the dimensions of hand luggage is 56 x 45x 25 cm with an interior capacity of 30 to 45 liters. In addition to a carry-on suitcase, you can also bring a handbag.

Practical, resistant and light luggage

There are several types, models and brands of suitcases on the market. The most practical is to choose a rigid and light suitcase, whether for a business trip, a city trip, a weekend or a long stay. Why a light suitcase? Simply so that your suitcase does not become a burden during your travels. For optimal protection of your personal belongings, soft suitcases are the most popular with tsa locks. In short, the small, light and resistant suitcase is the most practical for travel. Choose from a range of hard cases for the quality of their fabrics, such as the Delsey suitcase or the trolley suitcase.

translate-5.title: Focus on the beautiful town of Mougins
translate-5.h1: Mougins, a city between gardens and art
translate-5.contenu:
Mougins is a charming town in the Alpes-Maritimes department (Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur region), the capital of gastronomy and the arts of living. Located in the hinterland of the Côte d'Azur, this village with its atypical charm and deep-rooted medieval and artistic history, represents a place of exceptional quality of life because of its climate, its cultural and gastronomic dynamism, and its geographical location near the cities of Cannes, Grasse and Grenoble.

City of gastronomy

Mougins has been labeled a "City of Art and Crafts" for gastronomy since 2011. It is undoubtedly a city famous for the Provencal gastronomy offered in its 40 restaurants. For the past 13 years, the famous Festival "Les étoiles de Mougins" - international gastronomy festival - invited chefs from all over France to present to the public (nearly 40,000 visitors in 2018) a large number of Provencal culinary specialties. This festival also included an international competition for young chefs "Les Espoirs de Mougins" as well as cooking classes. In 2019, it becomes itinerant to promote French gastronomy internationally, and takes place in Tuscany (Italy) in Pietrasanta. The chefs will represent the French Riviera and the know-how of French gastronomic chefs abroad. In 2020, the festival returns to Mougins on June 6 and 7 to pay tribute to the Best Craftsmen of France: Jacques Maximin, famous starred chef for 40 years, will be the patron of the event.

The MACM museum

Mougins is a city of art and creation with harmonious colors and unparalleled luminosity. Its history has been marked by numerous visits by personalities from the cultural world. Many artists have indeed stayed in this small village with its serene and inspiring Provencal charm. Among them, Christian Dior, Edith Piaf, Jacques Brel, Catherine Deneuve, Man Ray, Paul Eluard, Cocteau or even Picasso - who settled here to spend the last 15 years of his life -. Located in the heart of the village, founded by businessman and antique art enthusiast Christian Levett, and inaugurated on June 10, 2011, the Mougins Museum of Contemporary Art offers throughout the year a permanent exhibition and several temporary exhibitions. The permanent exhibition includes works (drawings, sculptures, paintings) by artists such as Picasso, Matisse, Rodin, Cézanne, Dali, Andy Warhol and Chagall, as well as a collection of Roman, Egyptian and Greek objects from the ancient period (weapons and armor - the largest collection in the world -, sculptures, vases, jewelry, etc.) for a total of more than 700 pieces of neoclassical, modern and contemporary art The Provencal charm of Mougins still attracts many artists who have come to set up their studios or galleries, some of whom are internationally renowned.

Gardens and park

Nestled on a mountainside in the heart of the forest, Mougins is a medieval village with typical Provencal charm. Numerous green spaces, luxuriant vegetation, pine trees, olive trees and cypresses make this village a place to live in a quiet and relaxing quality environment in the hinterland of the French Riviera. With an area of nearly 560 hectares, the Valmasque Park, located between the communes of Valbonne and Mougins, represents a preserved natural setting that offers many possibilities for natural leisure activities. Numerous routes are proposed so that young and old can enjoy leisure activities in the middle of nature. Hiking trails, mountain bike trails, horseback riding, botanical trails, playgrounds, environmental conservation awareness... This natural park, divided into four sectors, benefits from an exceptional fauna and flora. On the edge of the park, the Fontmerie pond, a superb aquatic enclave of five hectares, is a true Provencal treasure, with preserved biodiversity and unspoiled beauty. Representing the largest colony of lotus flowers in Europe, bordered by several hectares of meadow, this exceptional place is home to more than sixty species of birds.

Why settle in Mougins ?

Moving to Mougins means choosing a remarkable quality of life in a preserved natural setting. With a sunny climate all year round and a rich cultural and gastronomic offer, Mougins is a place of life that combines culture and art of living. Exhibitions, shows, dance, music: this city steeped in history with a well-preserved medieval heritage is undoubtedly a dynamic place with a rich artistic and cultural offering. Its geographical location is also an undeniable asset: 15 minutes from the beaches of Cannes (and its famous film festival), 10 minutes from the city of Grasse, and less than an hour from the first ski resort, Mougins offers the tranquility of a secluded place to live in the hinterland while remaining close to more dynamic cities and numerous leisure activities, both in summer and winter. This flowery town, with its charming little pedestrian streets, typically Provencal, also offers a magnificent panorama of the bay of Cannes.

Investing in the purchase of a villa in Mougins

Due to its geographical location and the comfort of life it offers its inhabitants, the most star-studded city in France is a wise choice for investing in the purchase of a villa. Located on the old "Napoleon" road, near the cities of Cannes, Grasse and Grenoble, Mougins is a city of character and prestige, with internationally recognized gastronomic know-how and a preserved natural setting. Superb houses and villas are offered for sale in several areas. You can find a selection on john-taylor.fr. The medieval village, very well preserved, will delight the amateurs of old stones. The more modern neighborhoods contain luxurious properties nestled in the heart of magnificent Mediterranean gardens. Surrounded by forest, Mougins is a town that offers a superb view of an exceptional Provencal panorama. Hosting an internationally recognized gastronomic festival each year, and offering daily exhibitions and shows in a preserved medieval setting, Mougins is a city of art and culture. Close to the famous Valmasque park and a few kilometers from the cities of Cannes and Grasse, its location makes it a place to live that combines geographical convenience with the comfort of a Provencal climate and the calm of a preserved natural environment.

translate-6.title: Tourism: zoom on the different travel packages
translate-6.h1: What are the different travel options?
translate-6.contenu:
There are travel offers for all tastes: there are those for whom vacations rhyme with idleness, and do not want to take care of anything. Others will want to discover another country, another culture, or choose their stay according to their favorite sport. Which formula is right for you?

The all-inclusive stay

You have a family and you don't want to go through the hassle of finding activities that will please everyone? Or have you sworn not to touch a pot during your stay, and would like to have a choice of supervised sports activities? For a fixed price, including the ticket, the hotel and the meals, you can leave all your worries behind. Children's club, water sports, beach, bar, a relaxing vacation in perspective! On the other hand, this offer will not be modifiable or changeable, so don't expect to visit this beautiful city on a whim, or to try that little restaurant that looks so good.

Organized tours

You would like to discover a country, but you are a bit apprehensive? An organized tour will meet your expectations. Whether you are a group or an individual, you can choose from a range of services and destinations offered by a tour operator. In the country of your choice, you make a loop passing by sites of significant interest. You will discover the culture and customs accompanied by a local guide, who will also serve as an interpreter. Everything is taken care of, from gas to lodging, but you may have a choice of restaurant for lunch if you opt for half board.

The "à la carte" stay

Would you like to visit a city you've always wanted to visit, rent a car or go horseback riding? Your travel agency can offer you a combination of different services in order to offer you a unique trip. Usually designed for two or more people, you can make the trip of your dreams by customizing it.

The custom trip

The tailor-made trip allows you to realize a personalized trip, with the activities you dream of doing: excursions off the beaten track, rafting, trekking, or around a theme that is dear to your heart such as wildlife, photography, etc... Your travel agency will take care of everything with its agents on the ground. You make the list of your desires, what you want to do and visit, decide on your dates, who accompanies you, and your agency takes everything in hand to offer you an unforgettable trip. To really discover a country and its culture, the best will undoubtedly be to opt for a stay "à la carte" or made to measure, which alone will allow you to venture off the beaten path.

translate-7.title: Real estate : understanding the different diagnoses
translate-7.h1: The lexicon of real estate diagnosis
translate-7.contenu:
The real estate diagnostics are established in order to inform the buyers and tenants of certain technical aspects of the goods which interest them. They can also be requested by owners who wish to know the potential risks and therefore the work to be considered.

Understanding the key terms

Each diagnosis is established for a specific purpose. It is therefore important to understand the purpose of each one. If you are looking for a professional opinion/advice concerning real estate diagnostics, go to www.amiantediagnostic.fr.

The state of risks and pollution (ERP)

Some areas are exposed to risks that may be natural, chemical, seismic, mining.... A prefectoral decree defines the list of concerned communes in each department. When a property is built in such a zone, it is obliged to establish a state of risks and pollution. TheERP is valid for 6 months and applies to buildings as well as to land and plots. The document must be attached to the promise or the deed of sale in case of sale of the property concerned. The landlords are also required to attach it to the lease. This diagnosis engages the responsibility of the owner who is liable to a fine of 300 000€ and possibly 2 years of imprisonment. It is therefore essential to use a certified professional diagnostician to fill out the form. Penalties apply in case of false information and failure to voluntarily transmit the ERP to the buyer/tenant.

The report of the risks of exposure to lead (CREP)

Older homes, and more specifically those built before 1949, must be subject to a report on the risks of exposure to lead, a substance present in most old paints. The diagnosis consists of evaluating the lead concentration. The diagnostician directs his research on the coatings like paintings but also bricks and other old elements. If the exterior coatings such as shutters are old, they are also subject to a search for the presence of lead. In the same way, all the annexes built in anticipation of a current use (garage, laundry room...) must be diagnosed. The document is to be filled in by a certified professional who indicates both the concentration of lead and the state of conservation of the analyzed elements. A notice must be attached to the document to inform the owner/tenant about the health risks. In case of sale, the seller must provide a Crep of less than 1 year if the lead concentration is higher or equal to 1 mg/cm². This validity is extended to 6 years in case of a positive result. The validity is unlimited if the diagnosis reveals a lead content lower than 1 mg/cm².

Asbestos diagnosis

Also calledasbestos condition, this diagnosis is mandatory for all buildings whose building permit dates from before July 1977. It confirms the presence or absence of asbestos, a material harmful to health. If the diagnosis dates from before April 1, 2013, it must be redone. On the other hand, the validity is unlimited for the asbestos statements made since this same date of reference. It is nevertheless wise to request a new diagnosis following renovation work because the interventions could highlight the presence of asbestos not previously detected.

The gas diagnosis

A large number of homes are supplied with gas to cover needs as varied as cooking and heating. Nevertheless, the obsolescence of the installations constitutes a risk for the safety of the occupants. Since November 1, 2007, a gas diagnosis is therefore mandatory with the objective of verifying the state of the interior installations dating back more than 15 years. In addition to the main building, the outbuildings are also concerned by this diagnosis. It describes the state of the appliances and fixed piping, the layout of the installation spaces and the state of the accessories. The gas diagnosis must be carried out before the property is put up for sale or rented. It is carried out according to a strictly regulated methodology which requires the intervention of a qualified professional. It should be noted that the diagnosis does not require the dismantling of the installations. The report determines the actions to be taken, either as soon as possible or with the possibility of scheduling the work later. The diagnosis is valid for 3 years.

Lead diagnosis

The danger of lead for health was only noticed late, which explains why traces of this substance are still found in many buildings. The presence of lead is however a common cause of lead poisoning, but not only. The use of lead was common until 1948. It was mainly incorporated into paints, increasing the toxicity of constructions prior to this period. The lead diagnosis is carried out upstream of the Crep, the latter dealing mainly with the risks related to exposure to the material. Diagnosticians use a device equipped with a radioactive source to determine whether or not lead is present. A positive report is valid for 1 year in the case of a sale and 6 years in the case of a rental. Negative reports are valid for an unlimited period.

Electricity diagnosis

Just like the gas diagnosis, the electricity diagnosis is required for all housing where the electrical installation was made more than 15 years ago. It aims to check the state of the network in order to identify any weaknesses in the installation and therefore to plan the necessary corrective measures. The electricity diagnosis cannot be performed by an electrician. It is essential to entrust the task to a certified diagnostician who has the knowledge required to observe, analyze and determine the condition of the installation. The intervention is limited to the external circuit, which is sufficient to inform future occupants of the quality of the network. In case of sale, the electricity diagnosis is valid for 3 years. In the case of a rental, its validity is spread over 6 years.

The diagnosis of energy performance (DPE)

Our energy consumption is not without consequences on the environment. The DPE aims to analyze these impacts. The DPE allows to rate each home on a scale of energy performance. On the one hand, it evaluates the capacity of the construction to save or not the energy used. On the other hand, the DPE offers the possibility of determining the rate of greenhouse gas emissions of the same housing. The result of the DPE is valid for 10 years. However, it must be redone if renovations are made before the end of this period that could modify it. The real estate diagnostics to be undertaken are therefore generally conditioned by the age of the construction. In all cases, the diagnostician must be certified and the document provided to candidates for purchase or rental must be up to date, under penalty of sanctions.

translate-8.title: 9 activities to do during the winter vacations
translate-8.h1: What to do during the winter vacations?
translate-8.contenu:
Winter vacations may not be as long as summer vacations, but that doesn't stop you from making the most of them. Classic or more original, the possibilities promise you moments of relaxation but above all memorable moments in the company of your loved ones.[caption id="attachment_339" align="alignnone" width="1920"] Plenty of winter activities are waiting for you.[/caption]

Making snowmen

It's the perfect activity to fall back into childhood. If you live (or stay) in a snowy area, you'll just need to bundle up before making the three traditional snowballs. The snow must be wet enough, otherwise it will be difficult to pack. Make a large ball for the bottom of your man, then a medium one for his upper body and finally a small one for his head. Place the nose in the middle of the face. If it is customary to use a carrot, you can also use a red ball, a piece of painted wood... be creative. For the eyes, ping-pong balls, buttons or pieces of coal will be perfect. Just make sure they are symmetrical. Finish with a mouth made from the same objects used for the eyes or cut out of a plastic/rubber pipe that has been folded. All that's left to do is to dress your snowman with a hat, a cap, a scarf, a jacket... it's up to you. You don't have snow at home or maybe you want snowmen that won't melt? Stack canning jars of different sizes or line white socks to shape the bodies of your snowmen and then add details with felt, stickers or buttons. For home decor, used light bulbs and milk bottles are among the easiest options to make.

A wellness trip to a spa

It's been a long year and you've probably had your share of stress over the past few months. The winter vacations offer you the opportunity to decompress and recharge before tackling the new year. There's nothing like a wellness vacation to revitalize you, so plan a weekend or multi-day getaway and indulge in some relaxing treatments. There are many packages to choose from, so you are free to select the treatments you want. Don't hesitate to offer yourself duo sessions to share moments of pure well-being with your soul mate or a friend. Of course, you won't spend all your days at the spa. So choose a destination that offers you other perspectives that can be cultural, gastronomic, historical....

Spend the weekend in a mountain chalet

Imagine a traditional chalet surrounded by a vast space where pine trees and snow are in perfect harmony. You'll light a beautiful fire in the fireplace to warm up while you enjoy your favorite hot drinks or simply to tell/listen to stories by the fire. This may sound cliché, but it is always a source of infinite well-being. In addition, the mountain environment offers you many possibilities. Go hiking, roast marshmallows, make snowmen. Depending on the destination, you can go ice fishing or simply enjoy the peace and quiet that surrounds you. A weekend in a chalet also offers you the prospect of cutting yourself off from the world and temporarily forgetting your hectic lifestyle.

Discover the French Riviera to enjoy the superb climate

The legendary good weather of the French Riviera makes it a perfect destination for your winter vacation... in the sun. Nice has more than just water sports to offer. Discover its emblematic places like the Promenade des Anglais or the Place Masséna which lights up at the end of November or beginning of December. Stroll around the Christmas village, attend shows, skate under the sun. There is always something to do under the blue sky. The winter vacations are also ideal to visit museums without having to elbow each other because there are fewer people than in summer. In Menton, a giant ice rink takes place in front of the Halles from the beginning of December and during 4 weeks. The Biovès gardens are transformed into an enchanted forest where merry-go-rounds, donkey rides and food stalls delight young and old. Christmas parades are also organized regularly in a shimmer of colors. You don't have to bundle up to enjoy the season and the enchantment it brings with it. The sun will even be out! If you come at the end of winter, you will have the opportunity to attend the Lemon Festival. Citrus fruits adorn the city and are served in many different ways. Winter in Cannes is a bit wet, which does not detract from the city's charm. The sea is sublime under the effect of the wind and the rain (light at the beginning of the winter). In 15 minutes, you will reach the island of Saint-Honorat, a perfect destination to enjoy the peace and quiet and taste good wine. Of course, you should not forget the Croisette and its beautiful luxury stores. You will find beautiful outfits for New Year's Eve, prestigious gifts to offer to your loved ones.... Go to the Vieux Port where champagne and seafood await you in the most prestigious restaurants and trendy bistros. Saint-Tropez, Valbonne, Mougins... each Côte d'Azur destination has its own identity, but each one reserves you a Christmas vacation combining enchantment, mild climate and authentic animations. It is advisable to rent a villa in anticipation of this stay. For this, choose the John Taylor real estate agency that will meet all your requirements. You'll enjoy accommodation that offers all the comforts you need to feel at home. Moreover, renting a villa allows you to spend your vacations in a prestigious atmosphere. Privacy, security and freedom are promised to you, which lets you decide your program according to your inspiration of the moment. Moreover, the properties offered for rent can welcome you for a romantic stay or for a large group vacation. [caption id="attachment_340" align="alignnone" width="1920"] Skiing is the winter activity of choice.[/caption]

Go skiing...

It's a classic but one that is impossible to get enough of. Skiing vacations allow you to do sports in the middle of winter while enjoying magnificent panoramas. If this is your first time, there is no need to worry. Find out what schools are available in the destination and go for it. If you're already experienced, even better. Skiing will work both your endurance and your strength. This all-around sport will help you burn a lot of calories, enough to compensate for the greedy splurges we like to indulge in during winter. Moreover, this family activity is excellent for your health since it optimizes oxygen supply and blood circulation. Your stay in the mountains will purify your body and the hours you will spend on the slopes will boost your mind. After the effort, the comfort! Ski destinations offer several off-piste activities. Tasting local specialties, dance parties, game workshops, there is no shortage of opportunities.

... and sledding

It is also in the middle of nature that you can practice sledging, an activity that makes you laugh and forget the routine. It's a great way to get your muscles working. It is a sporty activity, ideal to keep fit during the winter vacations. Add to that the fact that speed brings its share of adrenaline and that the wind seduces by its invigorating side. Choose a well snowed and cleared space. The fewer obstacles there are, the safer it is. There is no guarantee that you won't fall, but that's part of the fun of sledding. Just let yourself slide and try to keep your balance.

Going to the Christmas markets

The Christkindelsmärik in Strasbourg is one of the most beautiful in Europe. It takes place on the Place Broglie but also in other parts of the city such as the Place d'Austerlitz or the Place de la Cathédrales. About 300 chalets take place, offering Alsatian pastries, gifts and decorations, but not only. A huge ice rink as well as shows and concerts also invite to enjoy this market which exists since 1570. The Christmas markets of Colmar are also very famous. The artisans meet in different places that form charming villages with sparkling decorations. For nearly six weeks, nearly 180 exhibitors keep the magic going in a setting that seems to come straight out of a fairy tale. The Christmas markets of the capital are also waiting for you at the Trocadero, in front of the Notre-Dame cathedral and on the famous avenue des Champs-Elysées. The animations create sparks in the eyes of children and allow adults to appreciate the magic of the season.

Go to the festival of lights

Head to Lyon to attend this festival organized around December 8. For the occasion, the people of Lyon place small lamps called lumignons on their windowsills. The facades of the buildings are decorated with the most beautiful light decorations. Interactive shows are organized throughout the city. Ephemeral works, surprisingly realistic installations... the route is punctuated with enchantments.

Try the winter culinary specialties

Winter is the perfect season to savor many traditional recipes. Raclette is obviously at the top of the list. This assortment of cheeses and charcuterie promises a ballet of exceptional flavors. Comforting, hot chestnuts abound on Christmas markets. Enjoy them plain, as an accompaniment to the Christmas turkey or drizzled with a hot chocolate sauce at the end of the meal. Fondue is another must. Abondance and Beaufort are the big stars in Savoyard cuisine. The preparation is sometimes enriched with a little Emmental de Savoie. If you are staying in the Jura, the fondue can be enriched with Comté cheese. The best winter vacations are those that you can enjoy as you please, in a spirit of freedom and lightness. No matter how much time you have, the most important thing is to live every moment to the fullest to finish (or start) the year in beauty.

translate-10.title: Top 5 must-do activities in Tenerife
translate-10.contenu:
Tenerife is the name of one of the islands of the Canary archipelago, located in the Atlantic Ocean at 1335 km from Spain, where it is attached administratively. It is a volcanic island with an area of 2034 km². If it is quite populated, it also offers vast natural spaces that attract many tourists every year.The tourist activity remains the main revenue of the local economy. The island even has two UNESCO World Heritage Sites: the Teide National Park and the city of San Cristobal de la Laguna. Tenerife lends itself easily to multiple activities and I would like to share with you my experience and the activities I tried during my stay in the Canaries.

1/ Flying over the beaches and landscapes of Tenerife in paraglider

To get off the beaten track and take full advantage of the beautiful landscapes of theisland, you need to get a bit of height. Paragliding is the perfect activity to discover the beaches of Tenerife from the sky. As a beginner, the tandem flight reassured me completely. I was afraid of vertigo, but I was finally inhabited by a feeling of extreme softness and a feeling of total relaxation. I went to https://www.paradise-tenerife.com/ for my first paragliding experience, and it was great. The take-off zones are located in several places and are accessible within an hour's drive from the hotels. I opted for the beach flight with incredible views of the ocean and a soft landing on the sand. The turquoise waters below us, the pristine sky, the jagged coastline and small resorts, all take on another dimension and it feels like you're gliding gently through the air, like a dream. Other paragliding options exist in other places.

2/ Go hiking to the Teide volcano

The Pico del Teide is the highest point in all of Spain and stands proudly on the island of Tenerife at 3715 m. It is the place to go for a hike in the center of the island. This volcano is an emblematic place of the Canaries and offers atypical landscapes. The ascent to the summit can be done by cable car which drops the hikers at less than 1 km from the summit but still leaves a nice difference in height of 200 m. I chose the more sportive option from the parking of Montana Bianca (2300 m of altitude). 8 km of trails for a difference in altitude of 1800 m! It is necessary to plan between 3 and 5 hours to reach the top of the volcano. The path crosses a national park of any beauty. The presence of the national park imposes some constraints like the limited number of tourists per day (150), so it is necessary to obtain a passage permit beforehand. There is a refuge and I did the ascent in two days to balance the efforts and enjoy the sumptuous sunrises and sunsets. I was marked by the part of the hike above the clouds and by the temperature differences but especially by the landscapes, I thought I was on another planet, it was hallucinating.

3/ Visit the villages of Masca and Santa Cruz

The village of Masca on the eastern part of the island is without doubt the place that made the biggest impression on me. This small hamlet is nestled in a kind of mountainous cirque and offers really impressive panoramas. If there was only one image to keep of Tenerife, it would be the one of Masca. The atypical place is an emblematic concentrate of this so singular nature. These steep mountains that tear the sky, these viewpoints that lead to the sea in the distance between two crevices give impressions of the end of the world. The place is so remote that there are few accommodation possibilities.Santa Cruz is the capital of the island. It is located in the north of Tenerife. It is a very cosmopolitan old city. I found it very pleasant to stroll in the pedestrian streets of the city center, they are lively and colorful, there are plenty of stores. I liked the heterogeneous side of the architecture. Indeed, the historical buildings are easily mixed with more contemporary constructions, which provides a great variety.The city also has a high number of parks where works of art are sometimes exposed. You can also enjoy the coastline and the beaches. The less frequented beaches are further away from the city center, I loved the Teresitas beach with its palm trees, not far from the charming fishing village of San Andres.

4/ Discover the pyramids of Güímar in the east of Tenerife

In the south east of the island is the ethnographic park of Güimar which houses step pyramids like those found in Peru. Their origin is unclear, they are 4 m high and there are six of them. Inside the park, several thematic tours allow visitors to discover the site while learning about botany with endemic plants and unique poisonous plants, local culture and history, and the volcanoes of the Canaries. An exhibition room also presents a space dedicated to the history of navigation in the Pacific Ocean. Finally, a museum is dedicated to the findings of the Norwegian anthropologist Thor Heyerdhal who discovered the pyramids and his theories on their origin.

5/ The beach of Los Gigantes

Imagine a black sand beach , surrounded by volcanic cliffs plunging into crystal clear waters, you are not dreaming, this place exists: it is the beach of Los Gigantes. The place is really beautiful and the cliffs of Los Gigantes are very impressive. With a kayak you can get close to the steep cliffs. I preferred to enjoy a natural swimming pool right next to the ocean where the water was very pleasant without too many waves. The fishing village of Los Gigantes is really a haven of peace. An ideal site for a lazy day, feet in the water. Bonus : Attend the carnival of Tenerife What would be Santa Cruz without its annual carnival ? During one week, the city lives to the rhythm of music and party. Tourists and locals enjoy themselves and live to the sound of local bands that deliver Caribbean music in a unique atmosphere. It is the most famous carnival after Rio. It goes on all night in a very festive but also family atmosphere. It is punctuated by several corsos and parades which are very expected. It is one of the major festivals of Tenerife. This little piece ofSpain in the middle of the ocean is really worth the detour and suits all tastes. I really enjoyed my stay and was able to discover the many facets of this charming island. The short flight ensures a complete change of scenery far from the beaten track, I highly recommend it.

translate-11.title: Positive asbestos diagnosis : how to react ?
translate-11.h1: What to do in case of a positive asbestos diagnosis?
translate-11.contenu:
In the 1970s, asbestos was considered a miracle building material. It was massively used because of its insulating properties and for its fire resistance. However, it was later found that the inhalation of its fibers could lead, in the long run, to serious health problems.Definitively banned in 1997, it is now subject to increased surveillance on old buildings. This is why the search for asbestos is part of the real estate diagnosis that any owner wishing to rent or sell his property must undergo. You have found asbestos among the construction materials of your apartment or house? Don't panic, simple solutions exist.

What is a real estate diagnosis ?

The real estate diagnosis is a compulsory step for the owner of a property, when he wants to put it on sale or to propose it for rent. It is a kind of technical inspection carried out by an independent professional. The latter will observe the state of the property in various aspects, which are grouped together in the DTT (technical diagnosis file). In the case of a rental, the DDT will be attached to the lease. For a sale, it will be added to the promise to sell. The price of the diagnosis depends mainly on the surface of the property. It is generally charged to the seller. However, the buyer and seller can agree to share the cost. In other cases, it may happen that the price of the diagnosis is entirely assumed by the buyer.

What is the purpose of a real estate diagnostic?

A real estate diagnostic is used to make a technical assessment of the property as it stands at the time of sale or rental. Among other things, it informs the future buyer of the possible upgrades he will have to make once the sale is concluded.The owner can carry out the diagnosis alone in two areas: natural risks and technological risks. The other diagnostics must be carried out by a professional diagnostician.To know :
  • What is the condition of the electrical installation (if it is more than 15 years old)
  • What is the condition of the gas installation (also if it was installed more than 15 years ago)
  • What is the energy performance of the property (also called DPE)
  • Is there any lead in the materials of the apartment or house? If so, what is the risk for the future inhabitants to be exposed to it?
Finally, the diagnostician looks for the presence of asbestos. Here again, he evaluates if this presence poses a risk to the users of the property.

The legislation on asbestos

In France, it was in 1906 that the question of the link between exposure to asbestos and the occurrence of serious health problems was first raised. In Caen, a labor inspector alerted the public to the high mortality rate among workers in asbestos spinning factories. This was followed by events and decisions that led, among other things, to the obligation to take asbestos into account in real estate diagnostics.
  • In 1973, asbestos was classified as a carcinogen by the International Agency for Research on Cancer.
  • In January 1997, the decree number 96-1133 prohibits the use of asbestos in France.
  • In 1999, a European directive provides for a total ban on asbestos in all member countries by 2005.
  • 2002 saw the implementation of an important standard: the AFNOR NF X 46-020 standard. It describes the procedure that must be put in place to perform an asbestos diagnosis. It is explained how to identify materials containing asbestos in old buildings.

Asbestos diagnosis: definition

All properties built before 1997 are subject to the obligation of an asbestos diagnosis if they are in one of these cases: sale, rental or work. These diagnoses are recorded and can be consulted by the future users of the place. A tenant, for example, may ask to have access to the DAPP (the Asbestos File of Private Parts). All real estate is concerned by this diagnosis, since it concerns businesses, individual houses, as well as collective buildings. If the diagnosis aims to inform future tenants or owners of property, it can also influence the progress of a construction site. If asbestos has been found on the site, the project manager is obliged to warn all the companies that are supposed to take part in the work. Also, the individuals attending the site must receive training in asbestos and a mandatory medical follow-up.

Procedure of the asbestos diagnosis

This is always carried out by an independent professional asbestos diagnostician. He starts by visiting the building or house and, initially, he simply looks for the presence of asbestos with the naked eye. If asbestos is found, the expert will take samples foranalysis. The latter will confirm his initial findings. Then, he evaluates the degree of degradation of the asbestos elements. According to this degree, he can recommend future works (confinement) which will help to avoid the dispersion of particles. He can also recommend a pure and simple removal of the problematic elements.

What measures should be taken in case of a positive asbestos diagnosis ?

If the diagnosis has revealed the presence of asbestos among the materials in your property, action will undoubtedly be required. Normally, for each zone detected, the diagnostician has defined one of three regulatory levels. The first level does not commit you to anything, except to regularly monitor the element in question. The second level obliges you to restore the area where the asbestos is degraded, in order to prevent the emission of particles into the ambient air. The third level requires the complete removal of the asbestos materials. It may be tempting to do the work yourself. However, you should know that this will certainly lead to difficulties, and even problems with the law. Indeed, an intervention on a premises containing asbestos requires heavy safety measures. Without these measures, you are putting your health and that of others at serious risk. Similarly, if you do not dispose of asbestos-containing materials in specialized waste disposal facilities, you expose yourself to legal action. Our teams of professionals are experienced in asbestos containment and removal. They have been rigorously trained to work in these particular conditions and are able to act without taking any risk, neither for them nor for you. In addition, the experts have their own network and know where to get rid of asbestos while respecting the law and the environment.

translate-12.title: 7 good reasons to buy a property in Greece
translate-12.contenu:
If you wish to buy a property in Greece to give your life a new dimension, a new color, you will be pleasantly surprised to discover the many advantages offered by this country to property buyers. Living outside of France for vacations, part-time or full time, is an ambition that many compatriots have realized. There is no need to go far away to get a complete change of scenery. We suggest you, for once, not to block your ears and to let yourself be guided by the siren song to the wonderful country of Ulysses.Greece has many assets for those who want to make a real estate investment and the following 7 key points will convince you. This was the case for me after having consulted thereal estate agency Mobilia of which my Athenian friends had spoken to me in the best terms. I can say that this agency accompanied me very well in the choice and the purchase of my second home in the sun.

1 : Everyday life at low prices

You have to go shopping in the local or village markets to realize how easy and pleasant it is to get fresh products for modest prices compared to those charged in French cities. It is not uncommon to find seasonal fruits and vegetables for between one and two euros, a nice salad for 50 cents. Fish and meat are always of good quality at prices that would make more than one dream in France. For other consumer goods, moderation is the rule even if the various crises that have shaken the country in recent years have upset the balance a little. Let's not be mistaken. This flattering portrait only applies to foreigners whose salaries are much higher than those of Greeks, who struggle to live comfortably.

2: Greece, a Mediterranean climate with a scent of eternity

"Let's go to the south of France or to other southern countries and we will also have a Mediterranean climate ", some will say. But this would be without counting on the multitude of climatic particularities of the Aegean Sea as well as the archipelagos that the gods have scattered over the blue and diaphanous waters of Greece. Living in Greece means saying "You" to the light and nature almost all year round, living all day long between the captivating nature, the enchanting seaside and the terraces and good restaurants of the many taverns. Whether in the city, in the country or by the sea, the property you will buy will offer you the magic of its terrace all year round.

3: Buying a property in Greece where prices are much lower than in France

Depending on the location and the type of property you buy, the average prices per square meter may surprise you by being three to four times lower than in France, especially in privileged areas. A seaside villa in Greece has nothing to do with the asking price of a property in the south of France. Moreover, and provided that you follow your possible work, you will find qualified craftsmen who will allow you to renovate your property at affordable prices. The prices of the real estate market in Greece will allow you, in comparison with the French market, to size your real estate project at a much higher level in terms of location, surface and land with the same budget.

4 : Keep all the advantages of the European Union by buying in Greece

Investing in real estate in Greece means choosing stability and keeping the same rules of the game, the same social guarantees and the same currency. The legal guarantees will be the same and you will not be considered as a foreigner, but as a European citizen. All administrative and legal procedures will be easier.

5 : Buy in Greece and benefit from an advantageous tax system

As everywhere else, when you buy your property, you will have to pay taxes and fees that will be added to the price of the transaction. However, these additional amounts are less than in France and the taxes you will pay each year will surprise you pleasantly when you compare them to the level of taxation in France. In addition, the Greek government has established new tax rules that are very advantageous for European retirees who come to live in Greece. This makes buying a house or an apartment even more attractive. A good real estate agency will also be able to guide you on tax issues.

6 : Gateway to the East and Gateway to Europe, Greece is a reassuringly distant neighbour

Buying a property in Greece does not lead to the difficult expatriation that some compatriots experience when they leave for distant horizons. Greece is the ideal place to explore new frontiers, to give in to a total change of scenery with all the advantages of remaining within the sphere of theEuropean Union. Crossroads between East and West, Greece is two or three hours' flight from all the major European cities. There are many reliable airlines. In addition, apart from the train, domestic connections by plane, road and boat are very efficient throughout the country.

7: Buying in Greece: living in the garden of human history

To be comfortably installed on the terrace and to contemplate the Acropolis, the Aegean Sea, the white villages, one of the numerous ancient sites, a fishermen's port or a beach well sheltered in its cove, the whole bathed in an incomparable light in a summer which seems eternal, here are your dreams within reach. The property you will buy will certainly place you in the heart of a scene where you will feel like a hero every day, following in the footsteps of Demosthenes and so many other men and myths who, century after century, have forged the culture and history of our Humanity. It is said, for example, that Greece has so many beaches and coves that a lifetime would not be enough to explore them all. Add the historical sites, the natural sites and the places of entertainment and culture and you will be sure never to miss a single opportunity to discover and learn from everyday life. You will certainly have the opportunity to reflect on your good fortune as you sit quietly on a terrace over hearty mezze and local wine while a tasty fish is carved fresh from the water that morning. translate-13.title: Why choose the gold card for your purchases?
translate-13.h1: Gold card: the essential tool for all your purchases!
translate-13.contenu:
Would you like more information about the famous gold card? You've come to the right place. You've probably already heard about it. There are many advantages to a gold card, but it is still quite difficult to find your way around with all the banks that offer it. So what is a gold card? How to get it and what are its advantages?

What is a gold card?

The gold card is a high-end bank card, therefore, of payment that allows access to various services and insurance guarantees. It allows you to receive privileges that simple blue cards cannot give. This bank card costs a little more than a classic Mastercard, which is why it is less accessible. Nevertheless, it is not reserved for the elite. This little golden card is offered by many banks. Moreover, since the arrival of online banks in the 2000s, the conditions for obtaining it and the prices have fallen relatively. It is often possible to make simulations to know in advance, if one has the possibility of obtaining one.

How to obtain this payment tool?

Nowadays,with the arrival of online banks, this type of high-end card is much more affordable than before. Long considered a privilege of the wealthy customer, it is now easier to obtain. Of course, the conditions for obtaining it vary depending on the bank. However, the banks base themselves mainly on the criteria of your salary. Indeed, the user must justify a minimum salary, generally higher than 1 200 €. Also, the opening of an account will be mandatory. Moreover, on this bank account, the bank can ask you to make at least one operation per month. It is sometimes necessary to have a minimum amount of savings. Finally, the last thing to know is that people who have been banned from banking will not be able to have access to the high-end card.

How much does it cost?

Finally, what is the fee for my card? Obviously, this card is not at the same price as a simple blue card. It is even conceivable, thanks to online banks, to have the golden card for free, but under certain conditions of income. By going to a traditional bank, you can count more than 100 € to enjoy all the banking benefits.

What are the advantages it provides?

Asyou can see, once you have a gold card, you will benefit from several advantages, as soon as you open an account. This concerns the limits and withdrawals, but also the insurance guarantees. Indeed, once the bank account is opened, you benefit from a higher ceiling. In general, banks offer payment ceilings of between €5,000 and €8,000. Concerning withdrawals, it will be possible to withdraw from any ATM larger amounts, in France and abroad. Withdrawals from ATMs can exceed €5,000, anda cardholder is covered in France and abroad. An insurance package provides protection when traveling. Repatriation, flight cancellation, loss of luggage... Who knows what can happen? When traveling, it is always important to take precautions, especially when it comes to buying the necessary equipment! Finally, after opening an account, you have the choice between immediatedebit and deferred debit. If you use a bank card with immediate debit, the transaction made on the account is taken into account directly by the bank. With a deferred debit, the payment is debited on the last day of the month. These insurances allow the user to ease the end of the month.Asyou can see, it is not that difficult to get a gold card. Ask your usual bank or research the proposals of online banks. Trying it is adopting it. Many advantages are available to make it your preferred means of payment. The Gold card is a credit card that can be used in conjunction with an annually renewable credit. It can be used in cash or on credit at the time of payment.

The French real estate market is remarkably resilient. While the health and economic crisis has affected the majority of economic sectors, real estate has never run out of steam. However, the new provisions enacted by the HCSF (High Council for Financial Stability) are not without consequence. The regulatory overhaul aims to optimize the security of loans, which goes hand in hand with the tightening of conditions imposed by banking institutions. At the beginning of the second quarter of 2022, several banks revised their rates, applying an increase of 0.05 to 0.45 points. The pandemic has changed the search criteria of the French, who are leaning towards an urban exodus, although major cities still retain their attractiveness to buyers. Luxury real estate Saint-Jean-Cap-Ferrat : look at the customer reviews

Luxury real estate Saint-Jean-Cap-Ferrat : consult your network

If you know people who own luxury real estate in Saint-Jean-Cap-Ferrat, do not hesitate to ask them for recommendations. The efficiency of word of mouth is formidable because the reputation of a luxury real estate agency is forged above all on the opinions of its customers. translate-15.h1: Mandatory real estate diagnoses to be provided before the sale of a property
translate-15.contenu:
Before finalizing the sale of your property, you must request a certified diagnostician to carry out certain mandatory evaluations. A technical diagnosis file must be given to the buyer. Here is a look at the diagnostic reports to be produced in the context of a sale.

Why must a property diagnosis be carried out?

[caption id="attachment_476" align="aligncenter" width="960"] Certain real estate diagnostics must be carried out before the sale of a house[/caption] The real estate diagnosticians ' mission is to evaluate a house or an apartment under different aspects. The objective of the process is to inform the buyer about the state of the property so that he can take the necessary measures to live there safely and without depriving himself of comfort. The real estate diagnosis is therefore used to determine the technical aspects of the housing. Depending on the results, there may indeed be points of vigilance. Thanks to the file provided to the buyer, the latter knows exactly what to expect before moving in.

Everything you need to know about the DDT: this mandatory document

The technical diagnosis file or DDT groups together all the real estate diagnoses carried out beforehand. It is generally given to the buyer of the property when the sales agreement is signed. In the absence of a complete DDT, your responsibility is automatically engaged. The buyer would be entitled to withdraw before the signing of the deed of sale and could also initiate proceedings before a court if he notices anomalies after the conclusion of the sale. To this end, it is essential that the file is well documented and that the validity period of each diagnosis is respected.

Call upon a company specialized in real estate diagnosis

The use of a certified diagnostician, such as Active Diag located in the Provence Alpes Côte d'Azur region, is mandatory, whether the property for sale is individual or part of a condominium. Each diagnosis must comply with strict requirements: the points to be checked, the reference indicators and the period of validity are not the same. Certified diagnosticians base their assessment on the guidelines in force and draw up a report accordingly. The results are factual. In the event that there are elements that require special attention, personalized recommendations are included in the report. You will then be able to correct the deficiencies.

Mandatory diagnostics if you are selling a house

The asbestos diagnosis is mandatory for properties with a building permit issued before July 1, 1197. It allows to verify the presence or absence of asbestos. Remember that asbestos is harmful to health. The diagnosis of non-collective sanitation is mandatory if your property is independent of the public sanitation system. The electricity diagnosis evaluates the interior installation when it was made more than 15 years ago. The gas diagnosis is also mandatory if the interior installation is 15 years old or more. The state of risks and pollution informs the buyer about natural, technological and mining risks. A diagnosis of airborne noise is required if the house is exposed to typical airfield noise. A diagnosis of merule is required in areas considered to be at risk. The energy performance diagnosis (DPE), the termite diagnosis and the lead diagnosis are added to the list.

Mandatory diagnostics if you are selling an apartment

In the case of an apartment, you must provide :
  • An energy performance diagnosis ;
  • An electricity diagnosis ;
  • An asbestos diagnosis: find out what to do if your asbestos diagnosis is positive;
  • A lead diagnosis;
  • A gas diagnosis;
  • A state of risks and pollution;
  • A termite diagnosis ;
  • An airborne sound nuisance report;
  • A merule diagnosis.
In addition to the DDT specific to the apartment, you must also provide the building's diagnostic reports so that the potential buyer is informed of the technical characteristics of the condominium. From natural hazards to energy performance, including the presence of toxic substances such as lead, all the technical data characterizing your house or apartment must be communicated to the buyer before the transaction is finalized. This is a legal obligation!

translate-16.h1: Renegotiate your mortgage insurance: the steps to follow
translate-16.contenu:
Renegotiating a mortgage insurance contract is now possible thanks to the Hamon, Chatel and Lagarde laws. Any insured person can renegotiate his loan insurance contract to benefit from several advantages.

What is a real estate loan insurance ?

Loan insurance represents a guarantee for both the borrower and the lender. The loan insurance on the outstanding capital or initial is not mandatory, but this insurance contract is required by your banker. This type of insurance is essential whenyou are making your first real estate purchase! This coverage can represent up to 30 or 40% of the total cost of financing the project. The borrower is obliged to repay the loan. However, in the case of serious incidents, such as death or disability, which could prevent him from paying the monthly instalments, everything will be paid for by the borrower's insurance. This credit insurance is a security for all parties and can be renegotiated at any time.

Reasons for renegotiation

[caption id="attachment_480" align="aligncenter" width="960"] Renegotiate your mortgage insurance with our guide![/caption] There are several reasons why a borrower might want to renegotiate their mortgage insurance with their banker. Every year, several interesting loan offers are made. Among the reasons to renegotiate one's loan insurance is the desire to make considerable savings ranging from tens of thousands of euros on the total cost of the loan. Borrowers can reduce the amount of their monthly payment or shorten the repayment period. You can keep the same guarantees as in your original insurance contract while paying less. Don 't hesitate to call on an insurance partner such as Socavie, to help you in your renegotiation process.

New mortgage insurance: what you need to take into account

The insurance sector has made great changes. In 2022, borrowers can take out a new mortgage insurance offer at any time. Thanks to the delegation of insurance, they can change their loan insurance with another company. The cancellation of the contract is possible, but it is necessary to take into account
  • The signature of the new loan insurance before the cancellation of the old one;
  • The respect of the equivalence of the guarantees between the two insurances.
Once you have found the insurer best suited to meet your needs, forward this to your bank and send them a dated and signed copy of the loan rider!

Renegotiating your insurance with your current bank: our guide

A borrower who is reluctant to change his loan insurance may prefer the option of renegotiating his insurance with his current bank. This involves lowering your loan rate with your bank in order to obtain better credit conditions, but this type of negotiation does not impact the insurance loan, but the interest rate. To save money on your loan insurance, you can negotiate with your bank the insurance, if your loan is covered by the bank insurance. If your negotiations are unsuccessful, you canchange your insurer, without justification and without charge.
