translate-17.h1: What steps must be taken to rent an apartment?
translate-17.contenu:
The profitability of a rental investment requires a strategic approach. Of course, it is important to rent quickly, but it is even more important to rent well. Rather than rushing into things, take the time to analyze your objectives and then take the steps that will optimize the success of the rental.

Choose the type of rental that suits you best

[caption id="attachment_484" align="aligncenter" width="960"] IF you are planning to rent an apartment, don't forget to do the essential steps[/caption] Are you going to opt for a seasonal rental? Are you planning to offer furnished rentals as the main residence of your future tenants? Do you prefer to rent empty? The different types of rentals each have their advantages and come with certain constraints. For example, a furnished rental allows you to provide your tenants with a ready-to-live-in property, but it also requires that you maintain the furniture and equipment in good condition. An unfurnished home requires the tenant to furnish themselves, which reduces the amount of your investment and allows future occupants to furnish the space to their liking. The location of your property is critical in that you will need to consider local market trends to identify the most profitable rental options and adjust the rent accordingly.

Don't forget to carry out all the mandatory diagnostics

Furnished house, empty apartment...whatever the type of property you are renting, you must imperatively foresee real estate diagnostics. The DPE (diagnosis of energy performance) is mandatory. It allows you to situate the property on a scale from A to G concerning the quality of the insulation, the energy consumption and the emission of greenhouse gases. For any property built before 1949, the lead diagnosis is also required. You should also consider drawing up the ERNT (état des risques naturels miniers et technologiques) which informs potential tenants whether or not your property is located in a risk zone. In the case of a property located in a condominium, contact the property manager to obtain the diagnosis of the common areas. Note that the validity of the documents is not the same. Therefore, think about getting information as soon as possible from certified diagnosticians. Note that these real estate diagnoses are also mandatory when selling a property. They are different depending on the type of property you wish to sell (apartment or house).

Think about studying the competition before taking the plunge

Rents vary greatly depending on the region. Moreover, neighborhoods located in the same city can reveal important disparities in rents. A wise landlord will therefore take the time to evaluate the local market before setting the rent. To do this, different criteria must be considered in addition to the location:
  • The size of the property
  • The quality of the equipment provided in the case of furnished accommodation
  • The standing (architectural style, quality of construction materials...)
  • Additional facilities (cellar, attic space, parking, pool, etc.)
Find out about similar properties and be particularly interested in the rents charged. You will be better positioned if you rent at a reasonable amount, whether it is for a seasonal or long-term rental. Be careful, this does not mean that you should underestimate the ideal amount of rent. If your services justify it, you may be able to set a higher price than the average.

Get help from an agency to find a tenant

[caption id="attachment_486" align="aligncenter" width="960"] A real estate agency will be of great help when renting an apartment[/caption] Finding a tenant is often difficult for the landlord. Of course, you can write an ad (with photos) and publish it on specialized websites. This means that you will have to be available to answer calls and provide all the information requested by interested parties. You will also have to be available for visits, knowing that they do not necessarily lead to the signing of the lease. The easiest way to do this is to delegate the task to an agency positioned in the local market. Once the advertisement is published, the agency will study the files of the potential tenants in order to evaluate their solvency. Whether it is for furnished or empty accommodation, it is always more advantageous for the landlord to sign a rental contract with a person who has a good capacity to honor the rents. This limits the financial risks.

Hire a chartered accountant to take full advantage of your income

The rental investment in a principal residence or in another type of housing generates land income. Managing this income is not as easy as it sounds. It is important to ensure that the rents are paid on time. If charges are excluded, you will have to invoice them in addition and make sure that they are collected regularly. A chartered accountant will help you in your steps and will advise you on the optimal management of your rental income. As an experiment, I advise you to contact LM Partenaire. Their professionals are experienced and will be able to accompany you in your real estate steps.

You will of course have to subscribe to certain insurances and guarantees

You certainly know that you must opt for a home insurance. There are different formulas which go from a basic cover to a multi-risk home insurance. At the very least, you should take out insurance to cover possible damage to your property, since no property is immune to material damage. It is also advisable to include a guarantee against unpaid rent in your insurance contract. If your tenant is unable to pay the rent, you can use your insurance to continue to receive your income. Discuss this with the insurer, who will inform you of the conditions to be met and the terms of coverage. By comparing several proposals, you will more easily identify the offer that corresponds to your project of renting your property.

Our advice for drawing up your rental contract

[caption id="attachment_487" align="aligncenter" width="960"] It is essential to draw up your rental contract correctly[/caption] After consulting with your real estate agency, you have selected your ideal tenant. Now it's time to prepare for the signing of the lease, which involves drafting a contract. Several pieces of information must be included in the contract:
  • The names of the landlord and the tenant
  • The type of accommodation (studio, condominium, independent villa...)
  • The description of the property
  • The amount of the rent and the terms of payment
  • The duration of the contract
Appendices are to be provided. In the case of a furnished rental, an inventory of fixtures must be drawn up. An inventory of the equipment provided and its condition is essential. This inventory of fixtures must be renewed before the departure of the tenants. In addition, the mandatory diagnostics must be complete and up to date. If in doubt about the documents to be drawn up by the landlord, seek advice from a local real estate agency.

Finally, don't forget to declare the rent of your property!

You have succeeded in renting your apartment or your house which now generates income. Congratulations, your investment has begun to pay off! However, don't forget that your income is subject totax and that as such, it is mandatory to declare it in order to comply with the requirements of the tax authorities. The applicable taxation depends on the type of rental. For example, the rents received via a furnished rental are taxed under the BIC regime and not as land income. Renting an apartment or a house requires rigor and a good sense of organization. Carry out your project with complete peace of mind by getting help from professionals who will advise you judiciously and relieve you of complex tasks.

Access roads and parking lots: for more comfort

Carros has an adequate geolocation

Carros is a crossroads city. Built on a rocky outcrop, the town offers a beautiful view of the valley. The quality of life is pleasant and there are many activities available for individuals, couples or groups. The location of Carros is not only advantageous for your employees. The geographical advantages also have an impact on the performance of your company. As any city belonging to the Nice Côte d'Azur metropolis, it offers excellent guarantees of visibility thanks to the strong fluctuation of potential partners and clients. What you should remember before signing a commercial lease is that the characteristics of the property that has caught your attention must conform to the nature of your activities.
